column4: my executable bits on my /bin/chmod seem to be wrong. howto fix?
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 50836 2010-09-21 14:33 /bin/chmod
wow, how did that happen?
the obvious answer of running chmod won't work...
dunno. even better thou, when I try to change it, I get 'Operation not permitted'
using a chmod executable I copied from another system
Are you doing it as root?
busybox chmod won't change it either.
yes. yes I am
root@bounce:~# busybox chmod +x /bin/chmod
chmod: /bin/chmod: Operation not permitted
Oh damn, busybox won't either?
try 'lsattr /bin/chmod'
hmm.. havn't had to play with that in a while
i is for immutable
You need to run chattr to remove it
hmm... I wonder how that happened.
yay..
i has chmod again.
heh... havn't played with lsattr in forever.
it sounds like something malicious attacked your system
